docs.snippet: Many pro football teams have added museums, historical displays and halls of fame to turn their stadiums into magnets for fans all year long....
docs.lead_paragraph: Many pro football teams have added museums, historical displays and halls of fame to turn their stadiums into magnets for fans all year long.
docs.abstract: Professional football teams are increasingly adding museums that hail achievements of their franchise; many such museums are located in stadiums, bringing visitors all year, rather than just on game days.

headline.seo: N.F.L. Teams Harness Stadiums as Museums
headline.main: Encouraging a Walk in the Hall of Fame
headline.print_headline: Encouraging a Walk in the Hall of Fame

docs.snippet: A Danish nonprofit wants to reduce female soccer players’ injuries. Its answer? A soccer ball that is lighter and slightly smaller in circumference....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Danish nonprofit wants to reduce female soccer players’ injuries. Its answer? A soccer ball that is lighter and slightly smaller in circumference.
docs.abstract: Claire Martin Prototype column examines new soccer ball developed by Eir Soccer founder Majken Gilmartin that is lighter and slightly smaller in circumference; new design is intended to reduce female soccer players' injuries.

docs.snippet: Can China continue its torrid pace of economic growth for decades to come? The long arc of history suggests not, according to a paper by Harvard’s Lant Pritchett and Lawrence Summers....
docs.lead_paragraph: Can China continue its torrid pace of economic growth for decades to come? The long arc of history suggests not, according to a paper by Harvard’s Lant Pritchett and Lawrence Summers.
docs.abstract: The Upshot; research from Harvard economists Lant Pritchett and Lawrence H Summers argues that China is unlikely to maintain torrid pace of economic growth over next couple of decades, with its economy becoming much larger than that of the United Sates; pair note that historic long view suggests countries with long periods of abnormal growth tend to revert to long-term global average of around 2 percent growth.

headline.main: Why China Won’t Keep Growing Fast Forever

docs.snippet: It's over. Madison Bumgarner finishes a four-hit shutout and the San Francisco Giants beat the Royals 5-0 to take a 3-2 lead in the World Series heading back to Kansas City....
docs.lead_paragraph: It's over. Madison Bumgarner finishes a four-hit shutout and the San Francisco Giants beat the Royals 5-0 to take a 3-2 lead in the World Series heading back to Kansas City.

headline.main: Bumgarner's Shutout Gives Giants 3-2 Series Lead
headline.print_headline: Bumgarner's Shutout Gives Giants 3-2 Series Lead

docs.snippet: In few states has the ground game been as intense as in North Carolina, where both sides are marshaling outside money and advances in data analytics to reach out to voters....
docs.lead_paragraph: In few states has the ground game been as intense as in North Carolina, where both sides are marshaling outside money and advances in data analytics to reach out to voters.
docs.abstract: Democrats' last chance to hold Senate majority comes down to vigorous get-out-the-vote effort; Republicans have been spending tens of millions of dollars to improve data collection to achieve rough parity with Democrats after being outflanked by superior Democratic turnout operation in past two presidential elections; in few states has ground game been as intense as in North Carolina, where Sen Kay R Hagan is in close race with Republican opponent Thom Tillis.

headline.main: For Midterms, Betting on Feet and Good Apps
headline.print_headline: For Midterms, Betting on Feet and Good Apps
